TopicTitle: [0.23] DC Aerospace v1.0.5 (ISRU, ECLSS, Space Stations, Satellites)

Articles.Content:
The Defcon Corporation Orbital Technology Division has been hard at work designing advanced new parts, ISRU modules, and even ECLSS systems! Whether you are looking to put some Kerbals into space, or even to colonise a planet, we've got you covered...

We are currently working on our custom plugin, which will generate resources on other planets, and also add in the things necessary to keep your Kerbals alive. With this mod, you will be able to create advanced vessels, and fill them with life! We are hard at work, and are positive that this part of the mod will be released soon!

If you are looking for more parts to create orbital craft, then you've also come to the right place! With DC Aerospace, we provide you with an enormous amount of satellite parts, so that you can design intricate satellites to put into orbit around anything in the Universe, or to send on deep space missions. Whatever your aim, we can help you get there.

Probe Cores:

Our main range of parts is an entire line of probe cores. We have designed them to match the specific purposes which they were created for, and we currently have two ranges of probes on offer (with more coming soon):

-The Voyager Range-

These probe cores are designed to allow you to conduct deep space missions, and pack many of the essential parts which you would otherwise need to attach to your craft- communications devices, SAS modules, battery packs, instruments... and, of course, the ability to remotely control your vessel. These cores are built around a 1.25m scale.

-The Horizon Range-

These advanced cores are the perfect platform to construct your own space telescopes around- featuring large reflecting chambers, lenses, solar panels, and all of the features of an orbital probe core, you can create fully-functional orbital telescopes within minutes!

We have also designed a wide range of satellite parts to add onto any of the satellite cores, to allow you to design extremely advanced, and compact orbital and/or exploration probes.

You can have this pack for your own space program right now, by going to the official page:

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/defcon-corporation-orbital-tech-pack/

A Showcase Of The Mod:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Defcon Corp. Orbital Tech Development:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

We are currently working on our custom combined ISRU, and ECLSS plugin, to allow you to collect resources from other planets, and also produce the necessary things which are required to keep your Kerbals alive!

Thank you for your patronage,

EsvDefcon, CEO, Defcon Corporation

Credit:

EsvDefcon- Code, Modeling, Textures

MetalMouth7- Modeling, Textures, Artwork

Deathsoul097- Modeling, Textures

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Disclaimer:

DC Aerospace is a mod which is a collection of parts, which are all original ideas of the authors. We are aiming to create a vast array of high-quality parts for KSP, which are designed to bring exciting new features into your game, and to allow you to build bigger, and better craft. This will remain the sole aim of our mod, and we will not be considering making the mod compatible with other mods until the DC Aerospace mod is at a point at which we are happy with it. We apologise for any inconvenience that this may cause, but please note that this will give us more time to expand the DC Aerospace mod, meaning that we will be able to create parts of a much higher quality.

Why have you started a new, identical thread for this?

The old one got a lot of bad rep and a few people were a bit ranty over the idea of hyperium. We believed that that might affect how other people saw us and our work, so we have made a new one.

I am not sure if EsvDefcon has asked already, but if a mod reads this, can they close the old one?

Also, I understand that It says ISRU in the title, however this currently isn't available as we are still flehing out many of the parts and the system itself.

Edited February 25, 2014 by Deathsoul097
You thought people's opinions and their voicing of them might affect how other people saw you and your work? Isn't that the point of a forum? Sorry but kinda have to call censorship on this

I agree with you on that, but the negative posts were on a part of the mod which has now been completely removed- this is an entirely new release of the mod, which will be bringing a completely different system into KSP.

Hi there. Been working on a panel for an ATV, and an ATV.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nbCy7_vf4dA

The Ceres ATV will be for station resupply, like the RL Cygnus. It will have a dedicated 5 way RCS port and a Docking Ring, and have inbuilt Fuel, Engines, Monoprop, and quite possibly Life support (For resupply. It will be unmanned.).
This is an awesome looking mod, but how much space does it take up?

As of now, it isn't a huge mod, but it does add around 15 parts (currently, but there will be MANY more parts once we're finished). We are going to be creating all of the parts for the ISRU & ECLSS once our custom plugin has been finished, so that will also take up some space. We do, however, use .mu model files and .mbm textures for quick loading (although .tga textures load faster-I may switch over current textures to these in the future).

You thought people's opinions and their voicing of them might affect how other people saw you and your work? Isn't that the point of a forum? Sorry but kinda have to call censorship on this

although i was one of those people who... wait a minute i thought i gave you guys good rep o.O and i offered to help even though i wasn't that good >.< but yeah i dislike censorship alot because of a computergame that got heavily censored by they're own game developer and i've never been the same since :/

I think its understandable to make a new thread with a significant vision change, as older, non-applicable negative feedback can easily poison someones perception of an entire project before they are willing to understand what is really going on. Look forward to seeing new stuff!
I have a question about Solid Hyperium, specifically how you are supposed to use it. I attached some to a craft and they do nothing. Is there a converter that hasn't been released yet?
